answers.answer: Its important to have a healthy diet during pregnancy but don't worry, I have had the same problem. At times all I can think about is fast food. Just make sure your getting some servings of fruits, veggies, whole grains and good proteins. You really don't have to be a health nut while pregnant although its encouraged. I would try and cut back though, you raise the risk of giving you and your baby gestational diabetes. Your dr will give you better advice though, so talk to him/her if you just can't seem to stay away from the junk food. We're pregnant, we get to indulge every so often ;)

If your taking prenatals slipping up shouldnt be that big of a deal. I know how it is, wendys and anything potato are my weaknesses. Just try and eat some veggies, or at least some v8 and welchs juice.

For my entire first trimester I was soo sick! 24 hour morning sickness. The only things I could eat we're fatty starches. Once that went away in my second, I was able to eat healthy again. I wouldn't worry too much as long as you put forth an effort moving forward. I am no super strict with my diet but I do make sure I get fruits and veggies in daily.

question: I'm so scared because I haven't really been eating very healthy , and i'm 12 wks , i'm going to start soon but I can't keep away fried foods is this a major problem???
title: eating healthy 12wks
